channel.title: Mamiya M645 on Grainy Photos
channel.description: Recent content in Mamiya M645 on Grainy Photos

item.title: El Torcal de Antequera, Spain
item.description: Fifteen photos from El Torcal de Antequera, an area of outstanding natural beauty and arguably the best examples of karst limestone formation in Europe.

item.title: C칩mpeta
item.description: Twelve photos of C칩mpeta and the surrounding area. C칩mpeta is renowned for its traditional Andalusian architecture, narrow cobblestone streets, whitewashed houses, and stunning views.

item.title: El Acebuchal, the lost village
item.description: Everything you need to know about El Acebuchal. The photographs were shot on Kentmere film with a vintage Mamiya M645 camera.

item.title: Photographing wild garlic
item.description: Eleven photos of wild garlic flowers taken with a Mamiya M645 vintage camera… and the problem I had with Fomapan 200 film.

item.title: Potes
item.description: A tour of Potes with 21 film photos. Potes is a picturesque town in the foothills of the Picos de Europa mountain range, offering history, stunning natural scenery and outdoor recreational opportunities.

item.title: Mogarraz
item.description: Twenty black-and-white film photos from Mogarraz taken with vintage cameras. Mogarraz is one of my favourite villages in Spain; it has history, is very picturesque, has a great location, and oozes charm.

item.title: Frigiliana
item.description: Frigiliana is a picture-postcard white village in Southern Spain - see twenty-four B&W film photos taken with a Mamiya M645 film camera on Ilford FP4 film.

item.title: Nerja
item.description: Nerja is a picturesque coastal resort town approximately 50 kilometres east of M치laga, Spain. 16 film photos shot on Ilford FP4 with a Mamiya M645
